cards.name: Aggron
cards.text: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Aggron by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Altaria
cards.text: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.

attacks.name: Midnight Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stadium Power
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Celebi
cards.text: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Leaf Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Drapion
cards.text: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.

attacks.name: Toxic Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

cards.name: Mamoswine
cards.text: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Snowstorm
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: Pheromone Stamina
abilities.text: Nidoking gets +20 HP for each Nidoqueen you have in play.

cards.text: Its tail is thick and powerful. If it binds an enemy, it can render the victim helpless quite easily.

attacks.name: Venomous Horn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Porygon-Z

abilities.name: Dimension Transfer
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error…

attacks.name: Suspicious Beam β
attacks.text: If Porygon-Z has no Rainbow Energy attached to it, Porygon-Z does 20 damage to itself and Porygon-Z is now Confused.

cards.name: Rapidash

abilities.name: Fiery Spirit
abilities.text: Rapidash can't be Confused.

cards.text: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredibly fast.

attacks.name: Ring of Fire
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Solrock

abilities.name: Heal Block
abilities.text: If you have Lunatone in play, damage counters can't be removed from any Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Damage counters can still be moved.)

cards.text: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

attacks.name: Sun Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Spiritomb

abilities.name: Spooky Whirlpool
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Spiritomb from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 6 cards.

cards.text: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.

attacks.name: Color Tag
attacks.text: Choose Grass Fire Water Lightning Psychic Fighting Darkness Metal or Colorless type. Put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon your opponent has in play of the type you chose.

cards.name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Poison Moth Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venomoth is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: The powder on its wings is poisonous if it is dark in hue. If it is light in hue, it causes paralysis.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Victreebel

abilities.name: Tangling Tendrils
abilities.text: As long as Victreebel is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.

cards.text: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.

attacks.name: Acidic Drain
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. Remove 3 damage counters from Victreebel.

cards.name: Ambipom
cards.text: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 2 cards from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the cards you chose, then have your opponent shuffle those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Tail Spank
attacks.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

cards.name: Banette
cards.text: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.

attacks.name: Lost Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Bronzong
cards.text: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

attacks.name: Legend Ceremony
attacks.text: Search your deck for both halves of a Pokémon LEGEND, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Bronzong to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.

attacks.name: Saliva Lure
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from Carnivine. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Dittobolic
abilities.text: The number of Benched Pokémon your opponent can have is now 4. If your opponent has 5 Benched Pokémon, your opponent must discard 1 of them and all cards attached to it.

cards.text: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

cards.name: Dragonite
cards.text: This marine Pokémon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.

attacks.name: Calming Wind
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Dragonite.

attacks.name: Dragon Stamp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.text: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.

attacks.name: Sand Impact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Dugtrio. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electivire.

attacks.name: Thunder Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Elekid

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Elekid is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Elekid by attacks.

cards.text: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pokémon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.

attacks.name: Sparking Ball
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Elekid is now Asleep.

cards.name: Golduck

abilities.name: Natural Remedy
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Golduck, remove 2 damage counters from Golduck.

cards.text: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

attacks.name: Powerful Splash
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Grumpig
cards.text: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.

attacks.name: Psychic Lock
attacks.text: Your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin for each of his or her Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage times the number of tails. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Kricketune
cards.text: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.

attacks.name: Entrancing Melody
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 100 more damage.

cards.name: Lunatone
cards.text: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Lunatone does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Machamp
cards.text: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Vital Throw
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Machamp does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Hundred Furious Punches
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Machamp.

cards.name: Magmortar
cards.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

attacks.name: Top Burner
attacks.text: For each Fire Energy attached to Magmortar, discard the top card from your opponent's deck. Then, flip a coin. If tail, discard all Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Nidoqueen
cards.text: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: It spreads its beautiful wings wide to frighten its enemies. It can fly at Mach 2 speed.

attacks.name: Headwind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Sharpedo
cards.text: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.

attacks.name: Strip Bare
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent discards all card from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Sharpedo.

cards.name: Wailord
cards.text: It is the largest of all identified Pokémon. They jump as a pack to herd their prey.

attacks.name: Underwater Dive
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from Wailord.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Wailord. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Wailord, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.

attacks.name: Search and Invite
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electabuzz.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.text: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 60 more damage. If you do, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

cards.name: Haunter
cards.text: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

cards.name: Kangaskhan
cards.text: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Dizzy Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Lairon
cards.text: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Lairon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Lickilicky
cards.text: It has space in its throat to store saliva. It can also roll up its tongue and store it in the same spot.

attacks.name: Licking Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Energy attached to Lickilicky. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lickilicky. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Luvdisc
cards.text: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.

attacks.name: Rendezvous Draw
attacks.text: Each player draws and reveals the top card of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Distorted Wave
attacks.text: Before doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.

attacks.name: Knuckle Down
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Magby

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Magby is Asleep, prevents all damage done to Magby by attacks.

cards.text: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don't underestimate it.

attacks.name: Play with Fire
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Magby is now Asleep.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards discarded in this way.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Marowak
cards.text: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bone Impact
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

cards.name: Nidorina
cards.text: It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: Quick to anger, it stabs enemies with its horn to inject a powerful poison when it becomes agitated.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: It renders its prey immobile using well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Piloswine
cards.text: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Porygon2

abilities.name: Mapping
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Porygon2 from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Further research enhanced its abilities. Sometimes, it may exhibit motions that were not programmed.

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Tentacruel
cards.text: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.

attacks.name: Tentavolve
attacks.text: If Tentacruel evolved from Tentacool during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Unown

abilities.name: CURE
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.

attacks.name: Double Attack
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Weepinbell
cards.text: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Corrode Target
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand, choose 1 card, and discard it.

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Aipom
cards.text: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.

attacks.name: Imitate
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

cards.name: Aron
cards.text: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.

attacks.name: Mountain Eater
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Aron.

cards.name: Bellsprout
cards.text: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

attacks.name: Inviting Scent
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.text: Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Bronzor during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Carvanha
cards.text: They form packs to attack boats and rip out their hulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Carvanha's Bite attack's base damage is 40.

cards.name: Cubone

abilities.name: Lonely Bone
abilities.text: Any damage done to Cubone by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 20 for each Marowak in your discard pile (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes and emits a plaintive and mournful sound.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

attacks.name: Sand Veil
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Diglett during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Gastly
cards.text: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Illumise
cards.text: Its fragrance attracts a swarm of Volbeat, so they draw over 200 patterns in the night sky.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vulcan Beat
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Volbeat you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Kricketot
cards.text: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.

attacks.name: Magnetic Switch
attacks.text: Switch Magnemite with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Nidoran ♀
cards.text: Although not very combative, it will torment its foes with poison spikes if it is threatened in any way.

attacks.name: Friend Search
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. It will strike first if it senses any danger.

attacks.name: Pheromone Poison
attacks.text: If Nidoran ♀ is on your Bench, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand.

attacks.name: Messenger
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle Pidgey and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.

cards.name: Porygon
cards.text: A manmade Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Porygon and remove 4 damage counters from Porygon.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.

attacks.name: Tripping Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Shuppet
cards.text: It uses its horn to feed on envy and malice, or so it's said. It's very active at night.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Skorupi
cards.text: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Spoink
cards.text: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.

attacks.name: Sleep Pearl
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: Its wings bring cottony clouds to mind. It grooms with springwater and loves to sit on heads.

attacks.name: Wing Flick
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Swinub
cards.text: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

cards.name: Tentacool
cards.text: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Venonat
cards.text: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove from Venonat the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Volbeat
cards.text: It emits light from its tail to communicate. It loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

attacks.name: Illumisile
attacks.text: If you don't have Illumise in play, this attack does nothing. Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Firefly Light
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Yanma

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If Yanma has no Energy attached to it, Yanma's Retreat Cost is 0.

cards.text: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.

cards.name: Black Belt
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,You may use this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent. During this turn, each of your Active Pokémon's attacks does 40 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Indigo Plateau
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Each Pokémon LEGEND in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +30 HP.

cards.name: Junk Arm
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. Search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. You can't choose Junk Arm with the effect of this card.

cards.name: Seeker
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Each player returns 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (You return your Pokémon first.)

cards.name: Twins
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,You may use this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent. Search your deck for any 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Rescue Energy
cards.text: Rescue Energy provides Colorless Energy. If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, put that Pokémon back into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Eye of Disaster
abilities.text: As long as Absol is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent puts a Basic Pokémon from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vicious Claw
attacks.text: Choose 1 Pokémon from your hand and put it in the Lost Zone. (If you can't put a Pokémon in the Lost Zone, this attack does nothing.)

abilities.name: Forest Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Celebi is your Active Pokémon, you may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Celebi is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Time Circle
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to Celebi by attacks from your opponent's Stage 1 or Stage 2 Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energymite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, Electrode is Knocked Out. Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose as many Energy cards as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can't be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Catastrophe
abilities.text: As long as Gengar is your Active Pokémon, if any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out, put that Pokémon in the Lost Zone instead of discarding. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hurl into Darkness
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a number of Pokémon you find there up to the number of Psychic Energy attached to Gengar. Put the Pokémon you chose in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Fighting Tag
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Machamp is on your Bench, you may move all Fighting Energy attached to your Active Pokémon to Machamp. If you do, switch Machamp with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crushing Punch
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Champ Buster
attacks.text: Does 100 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

abilities.name: Magnetic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lost Burn
attacks.text: Put as many Energy cards attached to your Pokémon as you like in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards put in the Lost Zone in this way.

abilities.name: Lost Link
abilities.text: Mew can use the attacks of all Pokémon in the Lost Zone (both yours and your opponent's). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: See Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for 1 Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Insight
abilities.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, the attack cost of each of Yanmega's attacks is 0.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND
cards.text: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND.,When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lost Crisis
attacks.text: Choose 2 Energy attached to Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND and put them in the Lost Zone. If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

attacks.name: Moon's Invite
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND
cards.text: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND.,When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lost Crisis
attacks.text: Choose 2 Energy attached to Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND and put them in the Lost Zone. If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

attacks.name: Moon's Invite
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Palkia & Dialga LEGEND
cards.text: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Palkia & Dialga LEGEND.,When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sudden Delete
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it back to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Time Control
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to his or her Prize cards.

cards.name: Palkia & Dialga LEGEND
cards.text: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Palkia & Dialga LEGEND.,When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sudden Delete
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it back to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Time Control
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to his or her Prize cards.

cards.name: Alph Lithograph
cards.text: LOOK AT ALL OF YOUR FACE DOWN PRIZE CARDS!
